definition: a hoe/to hoe or dig/to weed/to get rid of
to root out the strong and support the weak (idiom); to rob the rich and give to the poor
to wipe out dissenters/to exterminate those who disagree

sentences.english: Let poisonous weeds sprout, then uproot them and plough them under for manure.
sentences.chinese: 毒草让它出来，然后锄掉，锄倒可以作肥料。

sentences.english: This hoe suits me very well .
sentences.chinese: 这把锄我使着很对劲儿。

sentences.english: At a school in Los Angeles, neighborhood resident Howie Nicholl is hoeing and raking.
sentences.chinese: 在洛杉矶学校，街道居民豪伊尼科尔是锄和耙。

sentences.english: Splashed on your bare branches are my tears like bloodstains.
sentences.chinese: 独把花锄偷洒泪，洒上空枝见血痕。

sentences.english: They chopped the cotton and hoed the corn.
sentences.chinese: 他们间棉花苗，锄玉米地。

sentences.english: Hoe in hand she steps through her portal.
sentences.chinese: 手把花锄出绣闱，忍踏落花来复去。

sentences.english: Every field was given at least one additional hoeing .
sentences.chinese: 每块田至少又锄了一遍。

sentences.english: No flowers, no wine, but who cares?
Spade in hand, I go out from under my fine curtain
sentences.chinese: 手把花锄出绣帘，忍踏落花来复去。

sentences.english: The first thing he saw was Mr. McGregor hoeing onions.
sentences.chinese: 他第一眼看到的是麦格雷戈先生正在锄洋葱。

sentences.english: I buckled to my hoeing and the work was done quickly.
sentences.chinese: 我加紧锄地，很快就锄好了。

sentences.english: They are hoeing the fields of corn.
Falling on the bare twigs with blood stains.
sentences.chinese: 独把花锄偷洒泪，洒上空枝见血痕。

sentences.english: Oh, throw down your plow and hoe, Rest not to lock your homes.
sentences.chinese: 哦，丢下犁，锄，休息不锁定您的家园。

sentences.english: After he had dug two rows, the emperor stopped and turned to the hermit and repeated his three questions.
sentences.chinese: 锄了两行之后，皇帝又向智者提出了那三个问题。

sentences.english: Hoe the wheat today, and the cotton tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 今天给小麦松土除草，明天锄棉花。

definition: to harrow/to break the ground with a hoe
to put one's hand to the plow
